list_definition.definition: absolutely accurate or correct in every detail; the same in every detail; precise

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: What are the exact measurements of the room?
For this recipe the quantities must be absolutely exact
He walked in at that exact moment.

list_definition.definition: (of a person, his mind exact) capable of being accurate over small details

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Accountants have to be very exact.

list_definition.definition: to force the payment of or giving of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We should exact fines from everyone who drops rubbish on the streets.

list_ex_of_english: Persuasive arguments were presented in favour of exacting the ultimate sanction in times of conflict.
My understanding of this matter—rather newly acquired—is that the penalty is exacted in respect of each tree.
All lifeboats are subject to exacting inspections and surveys conducted by the institution.
Can they say that anything has been exacted from them which has not been imposed upon the other citizens of this country?
Diabetes mellitus is a worldwide health problem affecting 1-2% of the population and exacting a high cost in terms of morbidity and mortality.
In practice, most econometrics does not meet this exacting standard.
The impetus, therefore, while creating (exacting!) motion does not at all "exhaust" itself, and so can be conserved in the absence of obstacles and impediments (like air resistance or friction).
If late third wave pressures have brought greater opportunities for contestation and participation in many cases throughout the region, in other countries they have exacted a deadly price.
